column5: I was taught in elementary school to never use an Oxford comma. It was not until I was an adult that I learned I'd been educated into one side of a great grammatical debate or even that what I was being told to NOT use was called the Oxford comma. I was simply taught that when lists were written out in a sentence they went "A B and C." *shrug* That's how I did it. It's what Mrs. Dounay taught me. I've since changed my ways as I have since Mrs. Seigel my typing teacher in 7th grade instilled the dogma of two spaces after typing a period. I'm flexible in thought that way. It sure is fun though to participate in the debate that still rages on.
